title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
r4tune - (00:01): where is it writing "Recent changes" ?  
r4tune - (00:02): i commented out the include recent changes document  
r4tune - (00:02): but it still has the title  
r4tune - (00:03): got it  
r4tune - (00:03): heh  
degro left #xwiki at 00:35  
r4tune - (00:46): http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/DefaultSkin?viewer=recyclebin  
r4tune - (00:46): its broken  
r4tune - (00:46): heh  
r4tune - (00:51): xwiki is god  
r4tune - (00:51): i don't need a window manager  
r4tune - (00:51): just xwiki  
r4tune - (00:58): $msg.get("xe.home.title")  
r4tune - (00:59): where is this coming from  
r4tune - (00:59): is there a WYS... way to edit it?  
r4tune - (00:59): or should i just run a velocity script in a sandbox or something  
r4tune - (00:59): xe.home.title value that is  
r4tune - (01:10): edit inline form on main page doesn't edit anything  
r4tune - (01:11): it shows the page rather than the source  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 01:18  
r4tune - (01:21): bblfish: hi  
r4tune - (01:22): $msg.get("xe.home.title")  
r4tune - (01:22): where are these properties kept  
r4tune - (01:22): and how do you change them>  
r4tune - (01:22): ?  
sdumitriu - (01:23): r4tune: These are translated messages  
sdumitriu - (01:23): The values are found in the server  
r4tune - (01:23): is the a way to edit them without directly editing the db?  
sdumitriu - (01:23): Inside webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/xwiki-core-2.x.jar/ApplicationResources.properties  
sdumitriu - (01:24): You can override them in a wiki document  
r4tune - (01:25): so http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/xwiki-core-2.x.jar/ApplicationResources.properties  
sdumitriu - (01:25): No, that's an URL  
sdumitriu - (01:25): It's on the filesystem  
r4tune - (01:25): aaaah  
sdumitriu - (01:25): Inside a jar arhive  
r4tune - (01:26): thanks  
r4tune - (01:26): you know i never wanted to learn java  
r4tune - (01:26): but i lm loving twiki so much  
r4tune - (01:26): i might have to learn it...  
r4tune - (01:26): xwiki  
sdumitriu - (01:26): Wait  
r4tune - (01:26): mea culpa  
sdumitriu - (01:26): You don't have to edit the translations  
r4tune - (01:26): i know  
sdumitriu - (01:27): You can just remove that and replace it with plain text  
r4tune - (01:27): now i know what it is i just won't use it as my title  
r4tune - (01:27): yeah  
r4tune - (01:27): but it is handy to know there might be properties i do want to changer  
sdumitriu - (01:27): Just delete $msg.get, and write "This is so cool"  
sdumitriu - (01:27): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications  
r4tune - (01:27): heh  
r4tune - (01:27): i think it's going to mostly replace KWIN as my method of operation  
r4tune - (01:28): since it has {{python{{  
r4tune - (01:28): :D  
sdumitriu - (01:28): Are you in USA?  
r4tune - (01:28): uk  
sdumitriu - (01:28): Oh  
sdumitriu - (01:28): Then why are you up so late?  
r4tune - (01:28): moving my stuff out of kbasket into xwiki  
r4tune - (01:29): with the {{python}} I can have it do all sorts of cool stuff  
r4tune - (01:29): it's like... an OS  
r4tune - (01:30): :)  
r4tune - (01:30): I'll publish my iT related notes on the web more as likely sometime too on xwiki  
sdumitriu - (01:31): Well, most developers are up during the day, but mostly me and cjdelisle are up at night  
sdumitriu - (01:32): So you're not likely to get answers so late  
sdumitriu - (01:32): Sorry  
r4tune - (01:42): hey it'm reading your api guide  
r4tune - (01:42): and i don't know jack about java  
r4tune - (01:42): but i know quite a few other languages  
r4tune - (01:42): so it's not that challenging  
r4tune - (01:42): i do have to change those properties too  
r4tune - (01:43): or the "breadcrumb" still displays welcome to your wiki as the back links  
r4tune - (02:01): doesn't xwiki be available to python?  
r4tune - (02:01): nope it is  
sdumitriu - (02:08): WDYM?  
r4tune - (02:08): i must have made a typo i was trying to make my "Python" space list all the pages in it  
r4tune - (02:08): but i done it now  
r4tune - (02:08): http://pastebin.com/H1NMLLfv  
sdumitriu - (02:10): nuvolari: Ping  
r4tune - (02:34): damn  
r4tune - (02:34): what's java doing  
r4tune - (02:34): it's hit my ulimit  
sdumitriu - (02:36): Which ulimit?  
r4tune - (03:03): process  
r4tune - (03:05): the anti (:(){ :|:& };:) one  
sdumitriu - (03:08): Well, it shouldn't  
sdumitriu - (03:09): It creates just one process  
sdumitriu - (03:09): But with a lot of inner threads  
sdumitriu - (03:09): Does ulimit also count threads?  
sdumitriu - (03:09): I thought it only counted real processes  
abusenius left at 03:26 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sdumitriu left at 03:27 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
r4tune - (03:54): it does only count real process afaik  
r4tune - (03:54): possibly it wasn't the process limit  
r4tune - (03:54): but fork was failing  
r4tune - (03:54): and killing proceses made it work  
r4tune - (03:55): i've got 2 gig of ram and 12 gig of swap  
r4tune - (03:55): so i don't know what else it could have been than process limit preventing the forking  
r4tune - (04:10): can you put spaces in spaces?  
r4tune - (04:11): like a tree structure  
r4tune - (04:20): !search tree

sburjan\_ - (09:43): hello sdumitriu  
venkatesh left at 09:44 (Quit: Leaving  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 09:44

evalica1 joined #xwiki at 09:45

sburjan\_ - (09:45): regarding the one about floating the Admin Page elements  
sburjan\_ - (09:45): the Open Office server breaks the design in some ways  
sburjan\_ - (09:46): let me show you a screenshot

evalica left at 09:47 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
sburjan\_ - (09:47): at least this is how my FF renders it on my resolution  
sburjan\_ - (09:50): don;t know how this could be fixed in order to keep the search where it is  
sdumitriu - (09:53): I might have forgotten to commit a line, I'll check  
sburjan\_ is now known as sburjan ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:01  
sdumitriu - (10:03): Indeed, I forgot one line  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:03  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 10:03  
sdumitriu - (10:06): sburjan: Should be fixed now, thanks for reporting  
sburjan - (10:06): with pleasure  
evalica1 left at 10:29 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
evalica joined #xwiki at 10:29  
vmassol - (10:51): tmortagne: good morning  
tmortagne - (10:51): vmassol: hi  
vmassol - (10:51): do you remember the jira issue for specifying the query string and anchor as part of a link parameter?  
vmassol - (10:51): (I can't find it but I'm pretty sure we had one)  
vmassol - (10:52): (or maybe not)  
tmortagne - (10:52): hmm not sure we have a jira issue specifically for it, it's possible it was part of the comments of another one  
tmortagne - (10:53): let me check  
sdumitriu - (10:53): Hi guys  
sdumitriu - (10:54): How about using (\* or ((\* as a wiki comment syntax?  
vmassol - (10:54): sdumitriu: you should comment on the jira issue  
vmassol - (10:54): at one point I wanted something more generic  
vmassol - (10:55): with semantic properties  
vmassol - (10:55): entering meeting  
tmortagne - (10:56): vmassol: can't find anything, i think we have nothing and was just suggested in some conversations  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 10:57  
Enygma` left at 10:57 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds

vmassol left at 11:01 (Quit: Leaving.

jbrBridge left at 11:23 (Quit: jbrBridge

tmortagne - (11:25): hmm actually wait i think it's a FF4 bug actually  
tmortagne - (11:25): yep that's it sorry for that  
tmortagne - (11:26): the last nightly build of FF does not seems to work very well  
sdumitriu - (11:29): sburjan: Done XWIKI-5433  
sburjan - (11:29): thanks  
evalica left at 11:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer

evalica joined #xwiki at 11:31  
sburjan - (11:32): sdumitriu, : these fixer are also committed for the 2.4.1 ?  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 11:35  
Enygma` left at 11:56 (Quit: Leaving.  
Enygma`1 joined #xwiki at 11:56  
evalica1 joined #xwiki at 11:57  
tmortagne - (11:58): cjdelisle: is it expected that we can't put any script in codeToExecute field of configurable obejcts ?  
tmortagne - (11:58): objects  
tmortagne - (11:58): currently it's impossible because of nested script protection  
evalica left at 11:59 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
cjdelisle - (11:59): codeToExecute is evaluated with velocity #evaluate  
cjdelisle - (12:00): It wasn't expected that you'd be able to put groovy into it because that would require weeks of security review.  
tmortagne - (12:00): cjdelisle: i'm nottalking about groovy  
tmortagne - (12:00): this fielmd contains wiki syntax  
tmortagne - (12:00): so i was expecting it to work like wiki syntax and used {{velocity}} macro in it  
tmortagne - (12:01): it seems very wrong to me that it force velocity in it  
cjdelisle - (12:02): Perhaps we could consider later on adding syntaxToRender  
florinciu1 left at 12:02 (Quit: Leaving.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:03  
sdumitriu - (12:06): sburjan: Only 2.5M2  
cjdelisle - (12:06): re "wrong that it force velocity": That is how all of the fields work, they interpret as velocity so that the entry can be $msg.get...  That is a copy of what was used for document titles.  
arkub left at 12:07 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
tmortagne - (12:07): the other field are only velocity but this one also support wiki syntax  
sburjan - (12:07): sdumitriu, : shouldn't we fix these minor stuff in 2.4.1 too ? I guess we'll have to release 2.4.1  
tmortagne - (12:07): so there is a mix of two things  
tmortagne - (12:08): wiki syntax also support inserting script  
tmortagne - (12:08): it should have been done like wiki macros  
cjdelisle - (12:09): "the other field are only velocity" no the velocity is placed into the document and thus rendered as syntax as well.  
cjdelisle - (12:09): (except in the case of the document title.)  
tmortagne - (12:09): since this field is supposed to be what you use when you need a custom admin page it should work like a page for me  
cjdelisle - (12:11): It's not difficult to render text in that field but to change it's behavior would be an api break.  
cjdelisle - (12:12): And it would mean we need to decide what exactly the test is for when to use velocity #evaluate and when to use $doc.getRenderedContent  
tmortagne - (12:15): for me it's pretty simple, when it's wiki syntax it does note make sense to use #evaluate since it's not velocity content  
cjdelisle - (12:17): So any time a value is pasted into the page, it should not use #evaluate.  
tmortagne - (12:17): what you mean by "pasted into the page" ?  
cjdelisle - (12:18): The title for example is taken from the title field, run through #evaluate and then it ends up in the page.  
tmortagne - (12:18): it depends how you defined your field i don't see what the user action has do do with it  
cjdelisle - (12:18): Thus the title is evaluated as velocity then rendered as syntax.  
tmortagne - (12:19): no it's not  
tmortagne - (12:19): templates does not support wiki syntax  
tmortagne - (12:19): and the title is not inserted into document content but in the UI  
cjdelisle - (12:20): Hmm. no not that title.  
cjdelisle - (12:20): <property>  
cjdelisle - (12:20): <heading>$msg.get('core.register.title')</heading>  
cjdelisle - (12:20): </property>  
cjdelisle - (12:20): ^^ from RegistrationConfig.xml  
cjdelisle - (12:21): Configurable has a line somewhere which says:  
tmortagne - (12:21): ok but again as i said it only depends how you defined your fields  
tmortagne - (12:21): if it's wiki syntax it's wiki syntax  
tmortagne - (12:21): if it's not supposed to be wiki syntax then you don't use it the right way  
cjdelisle - (12:21): = $obj.get('heading') =  
cjdelisle - (12:22): err no.  
cjdelisle - (12:22): = #evaluate($obj.get('heading')) =  
cjdelisle - (12:22): that's it.  
tmortagne - (12:22): for me  
tmortagne - (12:22): = #evaluate($obj.get('heading')) =  
tmortagne - (12:22): does not make any sense  
cjdelisle - (12:22): The heading property is evaluated as velocity.  
tmortagne - (12:22): either you use #evaluate and you escape the result either you don't use it  
cjdelisle - (12:23): Then it goes into the page content and is eaten by the renderer.  
tmortagne - (12:23): if it's a title i don't see why you allow wiki syntax in it  
cjdelisle - (12:23): How would I prevent it?  
cjdelisle - (12:24): Here is the exact code:  
cjdelisle - (12:24): #set($heading = $app.getValue('heading', $configurableObj))  
cjdelisle - (12:24): #if($heading && $heading != '')  
cjdelisle - (12:24):   == #evaluate($heading) ==  
cjdelisle - (12:24): #end  
cjdelisle - (12:25): The only way I can see to avoid something being rendered as syntax is to wrap it in an {{html}} macro  
tmortagne - (12:25): you can prevent it if you want to, i don't remember you proposing anything or even asking what to do for this use case, we already talked about that and there is ways to not interpret wiki syntax  
cjdelisle - (12:26): oh yes, you could use {{{  
cjdelisle - (12:26): (and hope the content didn't contain }}} )  
tmortagne - (12:26): i already described several times ways to implements an escapeWiki tool  
tmortagne - (12:27): it's very easy and it works whatever the content  
cjdelisle - (12:27): It depends on whether the content is in a {{code}} mcaro, an {{html}} macro or an {{{ block.  
cjdelisle - (12:28): You have different things to escape.  
tmortagne - (12:28): i'm talking about wiki syntax excaping  
tmortagne - (12:28): it depends on nothing  
cjdelisle - (12:29): But it won't work for escaping content of a macro.  
tmortagne - (12:29): if you are in {{code}} macro you don't want to escape wiki syntax you want to escape specifically {{/code}}  
cjdelisle - (12:29): Thus you need one escape function per macro.  
tmortagne - (12:29): and anyway know what you have around you here  
tmortagne - (12:29): so i don't see what this have to do with your use case  
cjdelisle - (12:30): The question was when do we evaluate velocity and when do we render syntax?  
tmortagne - (12:30): and i already answer that question  
cjdelisle - (12:30): Never velocity, always syntax.  
cjdelisle - (12:31): correct?  
tmortagne - (12:31): and it has nothing do do with where you do that  
tmortagne - (12:31): whay would you interpret something that sos not velocity  
tmortagne - (12:31): ?  
florinciu left at 12:31 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
tmortagne - (12:31): "Never velocity, always syntax." i never said that  
tmortagne - (12:31): again what i said is: if it's wiki syntax then render syntax, if it's velocity then evaluate  
cjdelisle - (12:31): Ok then not "Never velocity, always syntax."  
tmortagne - (12:32): I really don't see the complexity  
cjdelisle - (12:32): So you propose examining the content each time and trying to detect what to do?  
tmortagne - (12:32): no i don't  
tmortagne - (12:32): you know the content  
tmortagne - (12:33): you are implementing configurable UI, you know what your object is containing  
tmortagne - (12:33): also there is already types for it in object anyway  
tmortagne - (12:33): look at the property definition  
cjdelisle - (12:33): The content is whatever the implementer puts in the object. It's up to them to define it.  
tmortagne - (12:33): it's indicated if it's wiki syntax, plain text...  
tmortagne - (12:34): it's part of the class definition  
tmortagne - (12:34): that's what the WYSIWYG is looking at for example  
tmortagne - (12:34): to know it we should show it or let the field as plain text  
cjdelisle - (12:34): A part which is not intrinsic to the class IMO but that's another matter.  
cjdelisle - (12:35): Ok, so if we know the answer for all testArea props then what's the answer for string props?  
tmortagne - (12:35): i don't agree with you, you define what is your object fields types and define if it's wiki syntaxe or something else is part of the content type  
tmortagne - (12:36): IMO string props should not contains wiki syntax  
tmortagne - (12:36): if you allows wiki syntax you allow a bigger content  
tmortagne - (12:36): otherwise it's unusable  
proyvind left at 12:36 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
cjdelisle - (12:36): Ok, then we have a rule. "Text areas are defined by what they say, strings are always velocity and never syntax."  
proyvind joined #xwiki at 12:37  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:38  
cjdelisle - (12:39): Would you like to deprecate codeToExecute and add syntaxToRender or similar?  
tmortagne - (12:40): we could have codeToExecute and customContent maybe  
tmortagne - (12:41): to make it more clear how it's supposed to be used  
cjdelisle - (12:41): I'm happy with that.  
tmortagne - (12:42): sometime you want to execute some velocity with the standard UI and sometime you want a custom UI so i think we should separate the two concepts  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 12:52  
vmassol left at 12:55 (Client Quit  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:09  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 13:09  
lucaa left at 13:12 (Read error: No route to host  
lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 13:12  
lucaa1 left at 13:25 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
cjdelisle - (13:35): Is there any reason why PR should be needed by edit\*.vm?  
sdumitriu - (13:36): None at all  
cjdelisle - (13:37): I'll dropPermissions() for now, later we should have a "trusted boot" type system for ascending to PR when the document content begins rendering.  
sburjan - (13:38): sdumitriu, : the issue with log4j is present in today's build too  
sdumitriu - (13:38): sburjan: OK, I'll look  
sdumitriu - (13:39): cjdelisle: inline edit might need PR  
sdumitriu - (13:40): Since it does render the content  
cjdelisle - (13:40): That makes sense. I'll leave inline.vm alone then.  
evalica1 left at 13:46 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
evalica joined #xwiki at 13:48  
evalica left at 13:51 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
evalica joined #xwiki at 13:52  
sdumitriu - (13:55): nuvolari: Ping  
arkub joined #xwiki at 14:03  
venkatesh left at 14:13 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:54  
vmassol - (14:57): tmortagne and others: so WDYT about moving query string and anchors for links to documents to link parameters? (e.g. [[label>>whatever?queryString#anchor]] to [[label>>whatever||queryString="…" anchor="…"]]. That's for XWiki syntax 2.1 of course? If some of us agree here I'll send a vote  
sdumitriu - (14:58): +1  
vmassol - (14:58): the advantage is to remove any need for escaping in links  
sdumitriu - (14:58): Actually not quite  
sdumitriu - (14:58): If I think better about it, it means custom meaning for some parameters  
sdumitriu - (14:59): What does anchor mean for a mailto link?  
vmassol - (14:59): the params could be valid only for a given link type  
vmassol - (14:59): and be ignored for others  
sdumitriu - (14:59): How do users enter that in the WYSIWYG? You really think that they know what a QS is?  
vmassol - (14:59): I don't think we have to give meanings to these params for all cases  
vmassol - (15:00): sdumitriu: well how do they do that now?  
sdumitriu - (15:00): They just paste the full link  
vmassol - (15:00): nope  
sdumitriu - (15:00): Which they copied  
vmassol - (15:00): we're talking about link to documents  
vmassol - (15:00): not urls  
sdumitriu - (15:00): Only to documents?  
vmassol - (15:00): urls would stay urls  
sdumitriu - (15:00): OK then  
sdumitriu - (15:01): Let me rethink  
vmassol - (15:01): the cons is that it's a little bit longer to type  
vmassol - (15:01): than before  
vmassol - (15:01): but it's more semantically correct I think  
vmassol - (15:01): s/semantically/syntactically/  
vmassol - (15:02): (less magic)  
vmassol - (15:02): we could even group queryString and anchor together as extraData or something neutral like this  
sdumitriu - (15:02): OK, +1  
vmassol - (15:03): we probably need to fine tune it so I'll send a proposal mail  
sdumitriu - (15:03): mflorea: Try to change the color theme to "Inner dark" and then use the WYSIWYG. Can you do something about it?  
vmassol - (15:11): proposal sent  
vmassol - (15:11): sdumitriu: I call them parameters rather than queryString, makes it less technical and less related to URL  
vmassol - (15:11): s/call/called/  
vmassol - (15:12): if someone can think of a better name, it's most welcome  
vmassol - (15:12): first we need to decide if that's what we want  
tmortagne - (15:15): vmassol: big +1  
mflorea - (15:27): sdumitriu: are you referring to the background color of the rich text area? It is forced to white on purpose.  
sdumitriu - (15:28): OK, but the text color should be forced as well  
sdumitriu - (15:28): Since that way it's white text on white background
